snippet: Mike Battaglia of Churchill Downs made the Arkansas Derby winner Bodemeister the morning-line favorite for the 138th running of the Derby.
abstract: Churchill Downs oddsmaker Mike Battaglia makes the Arkansas Derby winner Bodemeister the morning-line favorite for the 138th running of the Kentucky Derby. Photo, Chart (M)
lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky. -- When the post positions for the Kentucky Derby are drawn and the morning-line odds announced, there is the expectation that some order has been installed on a riot of a horse race. Twenty 3-year-olds, mere adolescents, will go a marathon distance of a mile and a quarter for the first time, before more than 100,000 people, many teary-eyed from either the singing of ''My Old Kentucky Home'' or mint juleps. But on Wednesday in the Secretariat Room of Churchill Downs, the connections of 20 horses learned from what gate their horses would be breaking Saturday, and little else.

headline.main: Favorite for the Derby? An Oddsmaker Shrugs
